senses.sense_definition: A person who steals dead bodies from graves to sell them, typically to anatomists or surgeons.

examples.text: The medical school secretly paid the <w>resurrectionist</w> for the fresh cadaver.
Local villagers guarded the cemetery at night to stop the <w>resurrectionist</w> from digging.

senses.sense_definition: Someone who brings back abandoned ideas, practices, or works into use or notice.

examples.text: He acts as a <w>resurrectionist</w> of forgotten folk songs from the last century.
The literary <w>resurrectionist</w> brought the obscure novel back to print after decades.

senses.sense_definition: A believer in the future rising of the dead.

examples.text: The <w>resurrectionist</w> preached about the final judgment day to the congregation.
She remained a staunch <w>resurrectionist</w> despite the changing theological dogma.

senses.sense_definition: A person who sells repaired or reconditioned goods.

examples.text: The market <w>resurrectionist</w> sold the fixed watch as if it were new.
He made his living as a <w>resurrectionist</w> of old appliances found in scrapyards.

senses.sense_definition: A racehorse that suddenly recovers its stamina during a race.

examples.text: The old mare proved to be a <w>resurrectionist</w> in the final lap of the race.
Gamblers were shocked when the <w>resurrectionist</w> surged forward to win.
